00037 #include "egs_application.h"
00038 #include "egs_library.h"
00039 #include "egs_functions.h"
00040 
00041 #include <string>
00042 #include <iostream>
00043 using namespace std;
00044 
00045 #ifdef WIN32
00046 const char fs = 92;
00047 #else
00048 const char fs = '/';
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 typedef EGS_Application* (*createAppFunction)(int argc, char **argv);
00052 
00058 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00059 
00060     string app_name;
00061     if( !EGS_Application::getArgument(argc,argv,"-a","--application",app_name) )
00062         egsFatal("\nUsage: %s -a application -p pegs_file [-i input_file] [-o output_file] "
00063                 "[-b] [-P number_of_parallel_jobs] [-j job_index]\n\n",argv[0]);
00064 
00065     string lib_dir;
00066     EGS_Application::checkEnvironmentVar(argc,argv,"-e","--egs-home","EGS_HOME",lib_dir);
00067     lib_dir += "bin"; lib_dir += fs; lib_dir += CONFIG_NAME; lib_dir += fs;
00068 
00069     EGS_Library egs_lib(app_name.c_str(),lib_dir.c_str());
00070     if( !egs_lib.load() ) egsFatal("\n%s: Failed to load the %s application library from %s\n\n",
00071             argv[0],app_name.c_str(),lib_dir.c_str());
00072 
00073 
00074     createAppFunction createApp = (createAppFunction) egs_lib.resolve("createApplication");
00075     if( !createApp ) egsFatal("\n%s: Failed to resolve the address of the 'createApplication' function"
00076             " in the application library %s\n\n",argv[0],egs_lib.libraryFile());
00077 
00078     EGS_Application *app = createApp(argc,argv);
00079     if( !app ) egsFatal("\n%s: Failed to construct the application %s\n\n",argv[0],app_name.c_str());
00080 
00081     int err = app->initSimulation();
00082     if( err ) return err;
00083     err = app->runSimulation();
00084     if( err < 0 ) return err;
00085     err = app->finishSimulation();
00086 
00087     delete app;
00088 
00089     return err;
00090 
00091 }
